channel.title: Port Forwarding
channel.description:
okay i went to portforward.com and found my router and it showed me a list of stuff i can forward like linage2 and other games but wich one do i choose to forward my server
reward= rep++ and a mod spot on my server[br][size=1]Posted at: October 24, 2006, 09:28:42 PM[/size][hr]anybody care to help me

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @baracuda baracuda
item.description:
@baracuda wrote:

thats helps

xxxxxxxx[][] 80%

when i got to a certain point in setting up static it said if this does not have a dot in it you have a static ip

[glow=green,2,300]but i dont know what my static ip is[/glow][br][size=1]Posted at: October 25, 2006, 10:22:13 PM[/size][hr]bumperoooooo!![br][size=1]Posted at: October 26, 2006, 07:40:13 AM[/size][hr]bump

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

[quote=“mod taharok, post:4, topic:19896”]Easy. Go into your router configs and the rule there’s TCP prot will be “4594”. Ok then switch this to anything you want (id say like 43500). Save settings. Now go into your server.java and search for this:

public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594;

Change the “43594” here to whatever you changed it to on the port. I hope this helped you. Enjoy!

~Mod Taharok[/quote]
That doesn’t tell him what his static ip is ;).

And for static ip it should be what it says on guide if you already have one.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Easy. Go into your router configs and the rule there’s TCP prot will be “4594”. Ok then switch this to anything you want (id say like 43500). Save settings. Now go into your server.java and search for this:

public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594;

Change the “43594” here to whatever you changed it to on the port. I hope this helped you. Enjoy!

~Mod Taharok

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

click on “see default guide”[br][size=1]Posted at: October 24, 2006, 10:02:08 PM[/size][hr]Then it tells you how to set it up step by step. waits for reward ;)[br][size=1]Posted at: October 24, 2006, 10:02:39 PM[/size][hr]It will say::

Welcome to our guide list for the (router name here). Please select the program you are forwarding ports for from the list below. If you encounter any errors in our guides, please let us know by using our Comments page.

If you do not see the program you are forwarding ports for, be sure to visit our Default Guide for this router

Click on part in bold

Read full topic
